attributes.action: MP's, If 100.000+ sign a petition, you must all attend the debate.
attributes.additional_details:
We want the commons calender to include a period exclusively for debate of issues which have achieved 100.000+ signatures by petition. During this period all MPs from all parties MUST attend debates or lose allowances.
At present there is no record of attendance in the commons except for voting figures. This is not acceptable, as the public must be able to see whether their MP has attended any debate, petitioned or otherwise.
MPs are public servants, paid by the public purse, and, as we're reminded when we call any government agency, we are all customers of the state, and as customers we are entitled be listened to, and served.
We demand a good service for our taxes,and as customers, as voters and most importantly as Humans, we demand the right to determine how we live, and have our voice heard!

rejection.details: This is matter for a party not for HM Government
